answers.answer: Thyroid checked?The TSH is NOT an accurate portrayal of actual thyroid hormone status in body, so if Dr has checked and tells him he's "in range" it is a good idea to double check this and research it as well.Any lab tests? Blood work? Scans? MRI's?When has he been to dr to get exam'ed?Other symptoms? Pre-conditions? Diagnoses?Family history for anything similar?Diabetes checked for? Viruses?Just some questions to get some more info. Would love to help more, but it's hard over a computer. We're not docs. Can only offer advice or leads to look at...

I agree with Panda's questions,  and also noticed you're in the UK.Do you not have any access to health care?  I've heard nightmares about your medical care wait lists.He really sounds INCREDIBLY thin.  Can you get an emergency doctor's appt?
